cards.name: Exeggcute
cards.text: Even though it appears to be eggs of some sort, it was discovered to be a life-form more like plant seeds.

attacks.name: Loathe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Exeggutor
cards.text: It is called "The Walking Jungle." If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute.

attacks.name: Shake It Off
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of Colorless Pokémon your opponent has in play.

cards.name: Wurmple
cards.text: It lives among the tall grass and in forests. It repels attacks by raising up the spikes on its rear.

attacks.name: Flock
attacks.text: Search your deck for Wurmple and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Silcoon
cards.text: It drinks dew that collects on its silk and waits for evolution. Its hard cocoon repels attacks.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Beautifly

abilities.name: Miraculous Scales
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon-EX.

cards.text: It has an aggressive nature. It stabs prey with its long, narrow mouth to drain the prey's fluids.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: You may have your opponent switch his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Cascoon
cards.text: It never forgets any attack it endured while in the cocoon. After evolution, it seeks payback.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Iron Defense
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Dustox
cards.text: It violently flutters its wings to scatter toxic dust when attacked. It becomes active after sunset.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.text: It violently flutters its wings to scatter toxic dust when attacked. It becomes active after sunset.

cards.name: Nincada
cards.text: It can sometimes live underground for more than 10 years. It absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees.

abilities.name: Wing Buzz
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may discard a card from your hand. If you do, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

cards.text: Because it moves so quickly, it sometimes becomes unseeable. It congregates around tree sap.

attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Ninjask and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Shedinja

cards.name: Tropius
cards.text: The bunch of fruit around its neck ripens twice a year and is delicious. It's a highly favored tropical snack.

cards.name: Victini

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.text: The hotter the flame sac on its belly, the faster it can fly, but it takes some time to get the fire going.

attacks.name: Peck Off

cards.name: Talonflame
cards.text: When attacking prey, it can reach speeds of up to 310 mph. It finishes its prey off with a colossal kick.

cards.text: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

cards.name: Pelipper

cards.name: Voltorb

attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Electrike
cards.text: It stores static electricity in its fur for discharging. It gives off sparks if a storm approaches.

attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

cards.text: It usually forages for food on the ground but may, on rare occasions, hop onto branches to peck at shoots.

If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Ultra Ball
cards.text: Discard 2 cards from your hand. (If you can't discard 2 cards, you can't play this card.) Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Wally
cards.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-EX) and put it onto that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward. You can use this card during your first turn or on a Pokémon that was put into play this turn.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Wide Lens
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,Damage from the attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to is affected by Weakness and Resistance for your opponent's Benched Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Winona
cards.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Colorless Pokémon and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Double Dragon Energy
cards.text: This card can only be attached to Dragon Pokémon. This card provides every type of Energy, but provides only 2 Energy at a time, only while this card is attached to a Dragon Pokémon.,(If this card is attached to anything other than a Dragon Pokémon, discard this card.)

cards.name: Thundurus-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Headlock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Voltage Rush
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

cards.name: Gallade-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Swift Lunge
attacks.text: You may have your opponent switch his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Piercing Prizes
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your remaining Prize cards.

cards.name: M Gallade-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Unwavering Blade
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Latios-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fast Raid
attacks.text: If you go first, you can use this attack on your first turn.

attacks.name: Light Pulse
attacks.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: M Latios-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sonic Ace
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Hydreigon-EX

abilities.name: Dragon Road
abilities.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, the Retreat Cost of each of your Dragon Pokémon in play is ColorlessColorless less.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Shred
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Rayquaza-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Intensifying Burn
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck.

cards.name: M Rayquaza-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Emerald Break
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage times the number of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Shaymin-EX

abilities.name: Set Up
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench, you may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sky Return
attacks.text: Return this Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

cards.name: Wally
cards.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-EX) and put it onto that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward. You can use this card during your first turn or on a Pokémon that was put into play this turn.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Winona
cards.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Colorless Pokémon and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Energy Switch
cards.text: Move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: VS Seeker
cards.text: Put a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
